task.title: Event Builder: Simple Event
task.abstract: The Event Builder allows staff users to create both simple and conference style events, greatly speeding up the process of event creation in a unified interface.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Events tab and click the New button to launch the Event Builder.
Enter the Event Name, set the Registration Style to Simple, and select the Event Category. Click Save & Continue.
Enter the Event Display Name, Capacity/Ticket Quantity, Time Zone, Start Date, Start Time, End Date, and End Time.
step.info: The Event Display Name is displayed to registrants in the Community Portal. Check the 24-hour Time checkbox to use military time.

Use the Browse button to upload a saved image or paste the image URL into the Banner Image and Thumbnail Image fields. Enter text to the Event Overview field and customize the way it will display to event registrants. Enter the Calendar Reminder Text to display on the attendees Calendar item when using the Add to Calendar feature.

step.cmd: Click Tickets in the sidebar nav. Enter the Ticket Name, Price, Ticket Quantity, and Description. The Is Active checkbox must be checked in order for the ticket to be available for sale in the Community Portal. Use the Browse button to upload a saved image or paste the image URL into the Ticket Image URL field.
step.info: Check the Show Tickets Remaining checkbox to show event registrants how many tickets of that type are available for sale.

Click the Attach Form tab to attach a form to the ticket type. Click the Alternate Pricing tab to enter Early Bird and On-Site pricing. Click the Accounting tab to specify accounting details for event revenue. Click Save & Continue

step.cmd: Use the picklist to adjust the Ticket Display Order and use the Calendar field to select the Ticket Sales Start Date. Enter any necessary Registration Instructions.
Click Access Permissions in the sidebar nav to restrict visibility to the event and/or ticket type to users with a specific badge type.

Click Venue in the sidebar nav. Enter the Primary Venue/Location Name, Description, and Address. Check the Display Map checkbox to allow portal users to see a map of where the venue is located. Use the Browse button to upload a saved image or paste the image URL into the Venue Image URL field.
Click the down-arrow in the Preview In tab to preview the event in a specific site.
In the Status tab, select Publish to allow Community Portal users to view the event.
